title: cannot install intel 18.0.0.6
body:
Summary
I Could now not install Intel compiler (any version) or any other intel related software from spack. 
It has worked I removed the Intel compiler and now I could not install any Intel Software. Other software installation from spack works fine. 

The output of the build log is as follows.
```
/opt/cluster/spool/wsl/spack/var/spack/stage/intel-18.0.0-6stcaudoiv7nicc253fycddjcd2mlot6/parallel_studio_xe_2018_composer_edition/spack-build.out
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> './install.sh' '--silent' 'silent.cfg'
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The install directory path was changed to
/opt/cluster/spool/wsl/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/intel-mpi-
2018.0.128-v2hvszynbw2q7vdd4hi624tqn7a2miwz
because at least one software product component was detected as having already
been installed on the system.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please select at least one component before you continue.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
```
The Packages that are installed are (no intel anymore):

```
[root@hyperion /]# spack find
==> 113 installed packages.
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.8.5 -----------------------------
autoconf@2.69    gcc@4.9.3  isl@0.18         mpc@1.0.3        openssl@1.0.2k     zip@3.0
automake@1.15.1  gcc@7.2.0  libsigsegv@2.11  mpfr@3.1.5       perl@5.24.1        zlib@1.2.11
bzip2@1.0.6      gdbm@1.13  libtool@2.4.6    ncurses@6.0      pkg-config@0.29.2
cmake@3.9.4      gmp@6.1.2  m4@1.4.18        ompt-openmp@0.1  readline@7.0

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@4.9.3 -----------------------------
adept-utils@1.0.1  gdbm@1.13                     libpng@1.6.29         netcdf-cxx4@4.3.0   r-sp@1.2-5
autoconf@2.69      gettext@0.19.8.1              libpthread-stubs@0.4  nghttp2@1.26.0      readline@7.0
automake@1.15.1    glib@2.53.1                   libsigsegv@2.11       openmpi@3.0.0       spark@2.1.0
bison@3.0.4        gmp@6.1.2                     libtiff@4.0.8         openssl@1.0.2k      sqlite@3.20.0
boost@1.65.1       gobject-introspection@1.49.2  libtool@2.4.6         pango@1.40.3        tar@1.29
bzip2@1.0.6        gperf@3.0.4                   libx11@1.6.5          pcre@8.40           tcl@8.6.6
cairo@1.14.8       harfbuzz@1.4.6                libxau@1.0.8          perl@5.24.1         tk@8.6.6
callpath@1.0.2     hdf5@1.10.1                   libxcb@1.12           pixman@0.34.0       util-macros@1.19.1
cmake@3.9.4        help2man@1.47.4               libxdmcp@1.1.2        pkg-config@0.29.2   xcb-proto@1.12
curl@7.56.0        hwloc@1.11.7                  libxml2@2.9.4         python@2.7.14       xextproto@7.3.0
dyninst@9.3.2      icu4c@58.2                    m4@1.4.18             r@3.4.1             xproto@7.0.31
elfutils@0.163     inputproto@2.3.2              matlab@R2016b         r-codetools@0.2-15  xtrans@1.3.5
emacs@25.3         jdk@8u141-b15                 maven@3.5.0           r-dompi@0.2.2       xz@5.2.3
flex@2.6.4         kbproto@1.0.7                 mpc@1.0.3             r-foreach@1.4.3     zip@3.0
font-util@1.3.1    krims@0.2.1                   mpfr@3.1.5            r-geosphere@1.5-7   zlib@1.2.11
fontconfig@2.12.3  libdwarf@20160507             mpileaks@1.0          r-iterators@1.0.8
freetype@2.7.1     libffi@3.2.1                  nasm@2.11.06          r-lattice@0.20-35
gcc@4.6.4          libjpeg-turbo@1.5.0           ncurses@6.0           r-ncdf4@1.16
gcc@4.9.1          libpciaccess@0.13.5           netcdf@4.4.1.1        r-rmpi@0.6-6
```
I have tried to remove the intel mpi but this does not change anything.  it seams that it has some reference to this intel-mpi package even after the uninstall. 
I also tried to spack clean but this is also not help.
What can I do to resolve this and reinstall the intel compiler?

We are using centos 7.4 
We do not use any custom packages.yaml or modules.yaml
